about_the_game:
Corbel is a casual 3rd person city builder with a difference. Play as a giant and command tiny villagers to gather resources, transport goods, and grow food. Build this micro kingdom into a vast city while defending it from waves of gnome attacks or at your own pace in peaceful mode.

Tower over the buildings you create

A giant in a tiny world. Take part in construction, build dozens of different buildings piece by piece to grow your kingdom and strengthen your crown. You are the ruler here, expand your city at your own pace and decide its destiny, or kick a building down and start again.

Command your villagers

These villagers can't do it alone, pick them up and give them tasks, from mining rock to growing crops. They will do anything you tell them, but without guidance they are doomed. Build production chains staffed by your villagers to allow you to build your city.

Defend against hordes of enemies

Join the fight yourself, use a range of weapons to keep your creations and villagers safe from huge hordes of pillaging gnomes. Build towers and fortifications to assist in the defence of your kingdom.

Be the best ruler in all the land

As the giant you can do everything better than any single villager, mine, craft, and transport resources yourself. Pick your ruler and customise your coat of arms that will represent your kingdom.
